name: Duel With The Dealer
description:
An incomplete game for the Unearthing Your Old Games jam, Duel With The Dealer is meant to be a mini-game played within a larger campaign.  Your players will have a duel with an otherworldly Dealer who throws them into different settings and genres, while you and the players use a tarot deck to improvise what settings they go to, and what type of conflict occurs when you get there.

The rules of this game aren't complete, but the framework is there.  The only content missing at the moment is a list of scene premises for each of the Major Arcana.  They're all that would be needed to complete the game, and I honestly think developing scenes that suit you and your players would be better than any generic scenes I could provide.

This game is written in OpenDyslexic3 and is a plain-text PDF format.  There are suggested scaffolds to hopefully make the game more accessible to those who struggle with quick improvisation.  If you cannot afford this game, please DM me and I will send you a copy for free, no questions asked.
